_header: Take time in time and no time defer
Note: Concludes with first two lines of 513; cf. 6554.

CULLl510.First Lines:
Tak tyme in tyme and not deferQuhen tyme is past ȝe may do
                    wer…
CULLl510.Last Lines:
…Bettir is to suffer and fortoun to avidThane Easilie to clym
                    and suddanlie to slyd

CamMagPep2553.First Lines:
Tak tyme in tyme and no tyme deferQuhone tyme is past ȝe may
                    do wer…
CamMagPep2553.Last Lines:
…Bettir is to suffir and fortoun to abydThan haistalie to clym
                    and suddenlie to slyd
CamMagPep2553.Editions:
Craigie,  William Alexander. 
             The Maitland Folio Manuscript, Containing Poems by Sir Richard
                Maitland, Dunbar, Douglas, Henryson, and others.
             2 vols. 
             Scottish Text Society
         n.s. 7 (1919), 20 (1927); Edinburgh and London: Blackwood, 1919,
            1927: 1.344.

Banna.Transcription:
Tak tyme in tyme and nocht diffarquhen tyme is past ȝe ma do
                    war
Banna.Note: Single couplet in this MS; immediately follows 6330 and precedes 418.

Fox,  Denton,  and  William A. Ringler.
